text: This is a very good cider for me. Its a wetter cider than most and the balance of sweet sugars and tart apples.

(bottle - 750 ml) Gold pour with a soapy white head. Tart apple aroma with light spice, honey and a definite hint of the barrels. A mild touch of hops too. Sweet apples and honey at the start of the taste with a light funky and dry note and some decent spice coming up into the end. Finishes with a light sweetness from the barrel. Different but rather nice.

starts off clear, with immediately noticeable barrel notes in the nose, with fairly muted apple skin. Theres some suggestion of sweetness here, not a lot of complexity, though more likely covered up. Occasional floral honey notes, though more often just "sweet"
less sweetness than one would expect given the aroma, and I think thats great. the off-dry flavor is a little more complex, but quickly covered up by the barrel. Just not balanced between the two. Otherwise theres little to complain about here. Well done; would just like to see a larger cider component and less barrel dominance.

Bottle from Mike - thanks! Clear golden pour with no head. Apple, tart, and some herbal bitterness in the aroma. Taste is green apple and tart with light funk and bitterness. Low carbonation. Pretty nice.

Bottle from umich03jm. Really interesting idea with this cider. Pours a fairly typical cider color, with a light aroma with interesting notes mixed in there. Flavor is semi-sweet cider, earthy funk and wood in the background. Very balanced but stays interesting. A pretty refined cider. Nice to drink although I was hoping for more complexity based on the way they did this.

Bottle: The aroma consists of sour apples, vanilla, honey, light spice, and a touch of oak. It pours a transparent dark good with a small white head that quickly fades to a thin ring around the edges of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate sweet and tart apples with some faint honey. The finish has light-moderate lemon, white wine, light brett, must, oak, and vanilla. It?s medium bodied with mild carbonation. Overall, real tasty and dangerously drinkable at 8.5%.

Draft at The Oak. Pours a clear light gold with a some minor bubbles rising to the top. Awesome aroma. Apples, honey, vanilla, sour lemon, light barnyard Brett and oak. Taste starts with tart apples and vanilla then finishes with sour lemons and a hint of barnyard. Light on the tongue with a very soft bubbly carbonation. Best cider Ive had.

Smells like honey and apples with a slight sweated soaked spring morning thing going on. Clear gold color and slightly fizzy palate. The flavor reminds me of a granny smith apple pie. An odd very enjoyable cider.
On tap at Global Brew. Pours a clear pale gold with no head. Aroma is funky yeast. Taste is tart, sour funky yeast with a pleasant fruitiness of apples and pears. Lip smakin good!
First, most people on here are making comments about it being sour. Of course...it has Brettanomyces culture in it, which will make it sour. One of the best ciders/cysers Ive had.
On tap at the tap house. Aroma is a mild sour. Taste is tart and sour apples. Nice carbonation almost wine like. This is more sour than cider.
In tap at Riverside. Poured clear golden orange with no head. Funky crab apple aroma. Light carb med bod. Similar taste. Would be hard pressed to say this is barrel aged.

Shared 750 ml. bottle, with my portion poured to a Duvel tulip, showing a clear & bright, golden color, with a thin, bubbly ring around the perimeter of the liquid, and leggy spots on the glass. The nose was fruity, funky & musty, with a slight but fleeting hint of betadine on the edge. Light bodied, the taste initially presented just the right amount subtle sweetness, then apple, moderate tartness, mellow alcohol, and finishing dryness. Tasty, crisp, and palate pleasing.
Clear gold pour. Aroma of sweet apples, vanilla , and funk. Flavor is super complex? Tart apple, dark tart fruit, Brett, vanilla, oak, sorrel( finishes tart and dry.
Growler thanks to mittenator. Clear orange amber. Barnyard and oak aroma. Taste is apple, sour, oak and hint of vanilla. Smooth. Good stuff.-- rated with beerbasher
Draft at hopcat in EL. Clear copper with deep orange around the edges. Apple, musty barnyard, vanilla and wood aromas. Funk and some wood.

Tart with some nice hints of oak, vanilla, and slight grassy flavors. Overall quite impressive and complex for a cider.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A golden cider with a thin white head. In aroma, light sweet apple pulp with faint Brett notes. In mouth, a nice crisp and tart apple with light Brett, oak, very nice and smooth with residents apple juice, very nice. On tap at End of Everything beer fest Dec 22 2013.

Tap at Hop Cat - pours clear gold, still. Aroma is restrained bourbon, vanilla, tart apples. There is some brown sugar action happening as well. Tart, off dry finish. I wish the bourbon was more present, but its nice, all the same.

Draft at Hopcat , bourbon aromas, mild sweetness with faint bourbon flavors . Finishes sweet , very drinkable . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap. Deep golden amber with minimal head. Tart and very dry. Mild bourbon. Maybe some vanilla. Unless Im mistaken, this isnt a true cyser. Whatever it is, its tasty.
